nodes.text: The Corellian carousel was a maneuver developed by starship pilots because of the YT-1300 light freighter's enormous blind spot, which proved a serious issue in flight. It consisted in putting the ship into a slow left-hand roll when maneuvering under fire or when making an approach in traffic. Because of the single high-mounted rectenna he had added to his YT-1300, the Millennium Falcon, the Corellian pilot Han Solo needed to use the carousel very often, since the dish had an even larger blind spot than normal.
